data.title: About Our Classes — Oregon Children's Theatre
data.text:
Creative Dramatics

Use your imagination, share stories, and make new friends while building skills in teamwork, focus, and creative expression. Play theater games, gain self-confidence, and learn life skills in a welcoming environment. This active class focuses on creative movement, collaboration, and physical play.

Page to Stage

Using the stories and themes seen on our Mainstage while also creating new stories and original characters we will transform text from page to stage. Develop performance skills such as movement, character creation, basic memorization, and collaboration as you explore storytelling through the art of adaptation.

Music and Make Believe

Unleash your imagination as you journey through magical stories and musical moments. Explore singing, movement, and dramatic games while focusing on early musical development and performance. Gain self-confidence, and improve rhythm, coordination, concentration, and collaboration skills in this fun and playful class.

STEM on Stage

Dive into the wonderful stories of Iggy Peck Architect, Ada Twist Scientist, Rosie Revere Engineer, and more in this imaginative class. Bring science and engineering to life as you combine STEM learning with theatre and life skills! Spark your scientific curiosity, creative problem-solving, and critical thinking skills as we explore science, technology, engineering, and mathematics paired with performing arts.

Young Actor’s Workshop

A beginning acting class for our young performers! Develop focus, basic memorization, and character creation skills as you use your imagination to discover the building blocks of acting and performance. Through theatre games and exercises we’ll develop confidence, concentration, collaboration, and oral communication skills through storytelling and scene work.

Beginning Acting

Explore movement, voice, and improvisation in a great class to bring out the actor in you! Use theater exercises and entry level techniques to create unique characters and make strong dramatic choices. Build confidence and creativity and communication skills in this class for beginning students.

Musical Magic

Discover the joy of musical theater as you explore singing skills and basic choreography. Make the most of your voice and grow as a musical performer using hits from Broadway’s most popular shows. Build skills in coordination, creative expression, and collaboration in this fantastic first musical class for the aspiring singer!

Create and Perform

Throughout this class you will go through the process of staging an original play. Using theater games and activities, you’ll learn how to tell a story using a script and how to put that story on stage. This is a highly collaborative, creative class that focuses on writing, movement and scene work. A great class for students who want to work together to create an original theatre piece.

Intermediate Acting

Take your acting chops to the next level. For the experienced actor looking for the next challenge. Create complex characters and improve focus and performance techniques, while exploring skills that help you connect to scripts and fellow performers. Emphasis on creating believable characters physically and vocally, script analysis, improvisation, communication, and ensemble building.

Sing, Dance, Act

Become a triple threat! Combine vocal training, dance skills, and acting through song while performing some of Broadway’s best. Build self-confidence and your resume as you develop skills in creative movement, coordination, self-discipline, and collaboration. Work towards a shared goal with your ensemble as you develop an all new musical showcase. Then have a blast in a final showcase that will leave them standing! A great class for students who have a love for singing and musical theater.

Improv Jam

Learn to let go and act in the moment while strengthening your acting skills. Learn games and exercises that develop essential performance skills including collaboration, creative thinking, and comedic timing. Think on your feet, create memorable characters, and build confidence through the fun and challenge of improv. An essential class for any student interested in theater!

On Camera

Gain experience and self-confidence as you learn the fundamentals of acting for the camera. Using on- camera techniques, you’ll develop skills in film acting from how to slate, hit your mark, take direction, and more. Learn to focus and stretch your imagination while you build your toolbox for acting on screen!

Audition Pros

Sharpen your audition skills, build your focus, and learn how to showcase your strengths. This class builds self-awareness and self-confidence while working on the skills you need for giving great professional theater and screen auditions. Strengthen audition skills such as slates, cold reads, prepared pieces, and ensemble work, and enhance acting skills through scene and monologue work. Emphasis on creating believable characters physically and vocally, script analysis, improvisation, and ensemble exercises. Great for students who plan to audition for school or professional productions.

Advanced Acting

For the experienced actor looking for the next challenge. Practice a variety of skills and techniques that will hone your craft. This fast-paced class is designed for the actor who is ready to take their training to the next level and pursue theater in a more serious way. This class has an emphasis on creating believable characters physically and vocally, script analysis, improvisation, finding presence, and ensemble building. Please note that work outside of class may be required.

An Actor Prepares

Advance your monologue/scene work skills and sharpen audition techniques. Focus on the building blocks of acting: Character, Relationship, Objective, and Where. Use technique-based exercises to examine the text and strengthen your monologue performance while improving your communication skills, and self-confidence. A great class for students who are interested in the Young Professional’s program or pursuing theater outside of school.

Improv Troupe

Be part of your own improv troupe! Learn to let go and act in the moment with your ensemble of actors, with games and exercises that develop essential performance skills. This class for actors of all ability levels will focus on quick thinking, active listening, communication, collaboration and play.

Musical Theater

Built for the singing actor, this class is an intensive study for students who want to bring next-level skills to their musical theater performances. Learn how to make the most of your voice featuring songs from the Broadway cannon and perform a variety of dance styles and choreography for musical theater. Improve rhythm and character development through movement and voice.
